Detailed Description

Monitors files to fire an event after files are accessed or changed by by any process on the device (including this one).

Each FileObserver instance monitors a single file or directory. If a directory is monitored, events will be triggered for all files and subdirectories inside the monitored directory.

The following example demonstrates how to use the FileObserver class.

 class MyObserver : public gaia::storage::FileObserver {
   public:
     MyObserver(const base::String& path)
       : FileObserver(path) {
         // ...
     }

     MyObserver(const base::String& path, int32_t mask)
       : FileObserver(path, mask) {
         // ...
     }

     void onEvent() {
         // ...
     }
 };

Definition at line 48 of file FileObserver.h.

Member Enumeration Documentation

anonymous enum
Enumerator:
ACCESS 

Event type: Data was read from a file.

MODIFY 

Event type: Data was read from a file.

ATTRIB 

Event type: Metadata (permissions, owner, timestamp) was changed explicitly.

CLOSE_WRITE 

Event type: Someone had a file or directory open for writing, and closed it.

CLOSE_NOWRITE 

Event type: Someone had a file or directory open read-only, and closed it.

OPEN 

Event type: A file or directory was opened.

MOVED_FROM 

Event type: A file or subdirectory was moved from the monitored directory.

MOVED_TO 

Event type: A file or subdirectory was moved to the monitored directory.

CREATE 

Event type: A new file or subdirectory was created under the monitored directory.

DELETE 

Event type: A file was deleted from the monitored directory.

DELETE_SELF 

Event type: The monitored file or directory was deleted; monitoring effectively stops.

MOVE_SELF 

Event type: The monitored file or directory was moved; monitoring continues.

ALL_EVENTS 

Event mask: All valid event types, combined.

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

gaia::storage::FileObserver::FileObserver ( const base::String &  path) [explicit]

Equivalent to FileObserver(path, FileObserver::ALL_EVENTS).

gaia::storage::FileObserver::FileObserver ( const base::String &  path,
int32_t  mask 
)

Create a new file observer for a certain file or directory.

Monitoring does not start on creation! You must call startWatching() before you will receive events.

Parameters:
pathThe file or directory to monitor
maskThe event or events (added together) to watch for
virtual gaia::storage::FileObserver::~FileObserver ( ) [virtual]

Destructor.

Member Function Documentation

virtual void gaia::storage::FileObserver::onEvent ( int32_t  event,
const base::String &  path 
) [pure virtual]

The event handler, which must be implemented by subclasses.

This method is invoked on a special FileObserver thread. It runs independently of any threads, so take care to use appropriate synchronization! Consider using Handler#post(Runnable) to shift event handling work to the main thread to avoid concurrency problems.

Event handlers must not throw exceptions.

Parameters:
eventThe type of event which happened
pathThe path, relative to the main monitored file or directory, of the file or directory which triggered the event
FileObserver& gaia::storage::FileObserver::operator= ( const FileObserver &  o) [private]
void gaia::storage::FileObserver::startWatching ( )

Start watching for events.

The monitored file or directory must exist at this time, or else no events will be reported (even if it appears later). If monitoring is already started, this call has no effect.

void gaia::storage::FileObserver::stopWatching ( )

Stop watching for events.

Some events may be in process, so events may continue to be reported even after this method completes. If monitoring is already stopped, this call has no effect.
